strategy: Use XGBoost with the following settings: n_estimators=500, learning_rate=0.05, max_depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median, and use `pd.get_dummies()` for all categorical features to perform one-hot encoding. Split the data into train and test sets, train the model, and evaluate using the r2 metric.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

# One-hot encode categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_val_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_val, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Align columns (handle missing columns due to one-hot encoding)
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded, X_val_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)
X_train_encoded, X_val_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_val_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train XGBoost model
model = XGBRegressor(
    n_estimators=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=6,
    random_state=42
)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val_encoded)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission
submis

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

# One-hot encode categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_val_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_val, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Align columns using proper unpacking
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)
X_test_encoded, X_val_encoded = X_test_encoded.align(X_val_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train XGBoost model
model = XGBRegressor(
    n_estimators=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=6,
    random_state=42
)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_cs
